attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Sunni politician Saad al-Hariri said on Sunday Lebanon would never be an "Iranian province" hostile to Saudi Arabia, and attacked Shi'ite Hezbollah's role in the Syrian war in a speech reflecting regional tensions.

attachment.name: OPEC members increasingly keen to end oil glut: Nigeria oil minister
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The mood inside the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) is shifting from mistrust to a growing consensus that a decision must be reached on how to end the global oil price rout, Nigeria's oil minister told Reuters.

attachment.name: Fed's 'dot plot' looks increasingly out of touch on rates
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The Federal Reserve's rate path "dot plot" has become increasingly detached from financial markets' interest-rate projections and risks sending an overly hawkish message that may undermine the central bank's credibility.

attachment.name: Obama urges Russia to stop bombing 'moderate' Syria rebels
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: U.S. President Barack Obama urged Russia on Sunday to stop bombing "moderate" rebels in Syria in support of its ally Bashar al-Assad, a campaign seen in the West as a major obstacle to latest efforts to end the war.

attachment.name: Modi urged to make reality match 'Make in India' hype
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Thousands of people and mascots of lions swarmed the weekend opening of a "Make in India" drive to attract foreign direct investment, pitched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi as "the biggest brand that India has ever created".

attachment.name: Civilian casualties in Afghanistan hit record high - U.N.
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Civilian casualties of the war in Afghanistan rose to record levels for the seventh year in row in 2015, as violence spread across the country in the wake of the withdrawal of most international troops, the United Nations reported on Sunday.

attachment.name: Global slowdown fears overshadow Singapore aviation show
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Aerospace leaders gathering for this week's Singapore Airshow face conflicting pressures as they juggle growing concerns over jetliner demand while keeping record production plans on track.

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: President Barack Obama has a number of likely options as he looks for a nominee to the U.S. Supreme Court to replace Justice Antonin Scalia, who died on Saturday.

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: South Korea said 70 percent of the U.S. dollars paid as wages and fees for the suspended Kaesong industrial project, run jointly with the North, had been diverted for Pyongyang's weapons program and luxury goods for leader Kim Jong Un.

attachment.name: Senate leader McConnell says wait on replacing Scalia
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Republican Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said on Saturday that the next U.S. president should be the one to nominate a justice to fill the vacancy left on the Supreme Court by the death of Antonin Scalia.

media.alt: Conservative U.S. Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia has died, setting up a major political showdown between President Barack Obama and the Republican-controlled Senate over who will replace him just months before a presidential election.

attachment.name: Reaction to death of Supreme Court Justice Scalia
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: Conservative U.S. Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia has died, setting up a major political showdown between President Barack Obama and the Republican-controlled Senate over who will replace him just months before a presidential election.

message:
"He was a justice who did not believe in legislating from the bench and he is a person whom I held in the highest regard and will always greatly respect his intelligence and conviction to uphold the constitution of our country." -- Donald Trump 

More reaction to Justice Scalia's death from top political figures: http://reut.rs/211LtCn

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

attachment.name: Japan lifts nuclear sanctions on Iran
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Japan on Friday lifted sanctions on Iran, falling in line with major world powers after the United Nations atomic energy agency confirmed last weekend that Tehran had fully taken steps to curb its disputed nuclear program.

attachment.name: China shares end higher on global stimulus hopes
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: China's fragile shares ended higher on Friday, in a relatively muted response to hints of more policy stimulus in Europe and Japan that prompted a robust rally in battered oil prices and equities elsewhere.

attachment.name: Oil prices bounce as cold U.S., EU weather buoys demand
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Oil prices rose for a second session on Friday, moving further away from 12-year lows plumbed earlier this week, as cold U.S. and European weather as well as firmer financial markets gave traders reason to cash in on record short positions.

attachment.name: Wife of U.S. pastor imprisoned in Iran hopes to reunite, rebuild marriage
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Naghmeh Abedini is looking forward to reuniting next week with her husband, Saeed, the Iranian-American pastor freed on Saturday after more than three years in an Iranian prison.

attachment.name: Asia stocks rise as ECB soothes nervous markets, oil extends bounce
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Asian stocks rose on Friday after a hint of more monetary easing by the European Central Bank and a bounce in crude oil from 12-year lows helped soothe skittish markets.

attachment.name: EPA official resigns over Flint water crisis
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The head of the Midwest region of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency offered her resignation over the water contamination crisis in Flint, Michigan, the agency said on Thursday, as it issued an emergency order to resolve the growing problem.

attachment.name: Davos elite alarmed at prospect of nominee Trump
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: "Unbelievable", "embarrassing" even "dangerous" are some of the words the financial elite gathered at the World Economic Forum conference in the Swiss resort of Davos have been using to describe U.S. Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump.

attachment.name: Podcast: Oil’s long goodbye and what comes next
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message:
Since the breakup of the Soviet Union, Russia has used natural gas as a weapon against Ukraine and Europe as a whole. Threatening to turn shut off the pipes as the weather turns cold is a pretty effective way to influence foreign policy.

But now it looks like one of Vladimir Putin’s key weapons is losing some its punch. 

This week on War College we’re looking at how shifts in the production of oil and natural gas are effecting global security, and where that leaves the United States. Download the War College podcast and find out more: http://reut.rs/1QhuCqi

media.alt: A suicide car bomber targeted a van carrying journalists working for a private Afghan television channel on Wednesday, killing seven people during evening rush hour close to the national parliament in Kabul, officials said.It was the latest in a series of suicide attacks in the Afghan capital that coincide with renewed efforts to revive a peace process with Taliban insurgents that broke down in July.The bomber targeted a vehicle owned by a company that works with Tolo News, Afghanistan's first 24-hour news channel, Kabul Police Chief Abdul Rahman Rahimi told reporters. He did not say how many of those in the van were killed or wounded.

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Former Thai prime ministers Thaksin Shinawatra and his sister Yingluck are cranking up their promotional machines to reconnect with supporters in apparent defiance of the military that toppled their governments.

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

attachment.name: Asian shares skid to 2011 levels as oil slump intensifies
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Asian shares slid to their lowest levels since late 2011 on Monday after weak U.S. economic data and massive falls in oil prices stoked further worries about a global economic downturn.

attachment.name: U.S. and EU firms warn of 'enormous' consequences if data pact talks fail
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The two largest American and European trade groups have warned of "enormous" consequences for thousands of businesses and millions of users if Brussels and Washington fail to wrap up talks on a data transfer pact by the end of the month.

attachment.name: Iran moves from pariah state to regional power
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Iran's release from sanctions testifies to its new relationship with the United States as it moves from pariah state to regional power, a status that could come at the cost of Saudi Arabia, Washington's chief Arab ally.

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Free of international sanctions, unfettered Iranian oil exports might be expected to drive prices further below $30 a barrel.

attachment.name: Arkansas governor wants Civil War icon separated from MLK holiday
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: U.S. civil rights hero Martin Luther King Jr. and Civil War Confederate commander General Robert E. Lee will share a common holiday on Monday in three southern states, but perhaps for the final time in one of them, Arkansas.

media.alt: Three Iranian-Americans left Tehran on Sunday under a prisoner swap following the lifting of sanctions on Iran that is likely to thaw ties further with the United States as Tehran emerges from years of international isolation.

attachment.description: Three Iranian-Americans left Tehran on Sunday under a prisoner swap following the lifting of sanctions on Iran that is likely to thaw ties further with the United States as Tehran emerges from years of international isolation.

message: Despite Iran's regional tensions, the lifting of sanctions and the prisoner deal considerably reduce the hostility between Tehran and Washington that has shaped the Middle East since Iran's Islamic Revolution of 1979. http://reut.rs/1QfoTTO

attachment.name: Israel licks wounds as Iran sanctions end, looks to future U.S. aid
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Israel bristled on Sunday at the lifting of international sanctions on Iran and vowed to flag up any violations of its arch-foe's nuclear restrictions while drawing on U.S. defense aid to prepare for a possible military face-off in the future.

attachment.name: Rouhani hails 'golden page' in Iran's history as sanctions lifted
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: President Hassan Rouhani hailed on Sunday a nuclear deal with world powers as a "golden page" in Iran's history, and looked forward to an economic future less dependent on oil as the country emerges from years of sanctions and isolation.

attachment.name: Tightening Clinton-Sanders battle raises stakes for Democratic debate
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: CHARLESTON, S.C. - Tightening polls and rising tensions between White House rivals Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders could fuel a fiery Democratic debate on Sunday, their last face-to-face encounter until Iowa kicks off the presidential nominating race in two weeks.

attachment.name: Six Canadians killed in Burkina Faso attack, PM Trudeau says
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Six Canadian citizens were killed when gunmen stormed a hotel in the capital city of Burkina Faso on Friday, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Saturday.

attachment.name: Jakarta attack highlights jostle to lead Islamic State in Southeast Asia
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: JAKARTA - Last week's attack on Jakarta showed for the first time that Islamic State violence has arrived in Indonesia, but security experts believe the radical group's footprint is still light here because militants are jostling to be its regional leader.

attachment.name: Banks give back China investment quotas as clients bypass the middlemen
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Global banks have started to hand back investment quotas used to buy Chinese stocks and bonds because alternative channels for investment in China and the sliding yuan are making this once lucrative business unprofitable.

attachment.name: Singer Celine Dion's brother dies days after death of her husband
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The 59-year-old brother of award-winning Canadian singer Celine Dion died after a long battle with cancer on Saturday, two days after the death of Dion's husband, her representatives said in a statement.

attachment.name: Taiwan opposition wins presidency, China warns against independence move
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Taiwan's independence-leaning opposition leader Tsai Ing-wen won a convincing victory in presidential elections on Saturday and pledged to maintain peace with giant neighbour China, which warned it would oppose any move towards independence.

attachment.name: Baby born in Hawaii with brain damage confirmed to have Zika infection
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A baby born with brain damage at a hospital in Oahu, Hawaii, was infected by the Zika virus, U.S. health officials confirmed on Saturday, apparently the first case of the mosquito-borne virus in a birth on U.S. soil.

attachment.name: Obama declares emergency in Michigan over bad water - White House
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: U.S. President Barack Obama declared a state of emergency in Michigan on Saturday and ordered federal aid for state and local response efforts in the county where the city of Flint has been contending with lead-contaminated drinking water.

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Attacks on women in Cologne and other German cities on New Year's Eve have prompted more than 600 criminal complaints, with police suspicion resting on asylum seekers, putting pressure on Chancellor Angela Merkel and her open door migrant policy.

attachment.name: The ‘marriage of convenience’ between Saddam Hussein’s men and Islamic State
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Hussein was executed nine years ago - on December 30, 2006 - but he remains an important symbol for Iraq’s disillusioned Sunni Arab minority. His legacy as a supposedly strong leader who kept Iraq together, by brutal force, reverberates for Sunnis in the wider Middle East, which is wracked by sectarian conflict and stalled revolutions. Read more from Reuters Opinion columnist Mohamad Bazzi: http://reut.rs/1mzKPgf

Among the Chaouia people of the Aures mountains, a woman’s beauty used to be judged by her tattoos. But now, those fading etchings are a source of pain for the community’s older women. WATCH: http://reut.rs/1mAFXr7

attachment.name: Exclusive - Saudi Arabia says to cut flights, trade with Iran, ban visits
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Saudi Arabia's breach of ties with Iran will extend to cutting air traffic between the countries, ending commercial relations and barring its citizens from travel to the Islamic Republic, Saudi Foreign Minister Adel al-Jubeir told Reuters on Monday. Read more: http://reut.rs/1mZUMEf

attachment.name: Quake strikes northeast India, Bangladesh; 11 dead, nearly 200 hurt
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: The pre-dawn quake killed six people in India and five in neighboring Bangladesh, officials said, while shockwaves were felt in the Himalayan nation of Nepal and as far away as the Myanmar city of Yangon, about 1,175 km (730 miles) to the south. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1OGv1Pw

attachment.name: What's ahead in 2016 | Reuters.com
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Exploring Jupiter, a new president for FIFA, Academy Awards and Presidential elections. Take a look at what's ahead for 2016: http://reut.rs/1mzIWA6

attachment.name: FBI seeks peaceful end to occupation at Oregon wildlife refuge
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: The occupation, which began on Saturday, is the latest skirmish over federal land management in the western United States. It followed a march in Burns, a small city about 50 miles (80 km) north of the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge, in protest over the imminent jailing of ranchers Dwight Hammond Jr. and his son, Steven Hammond. Read more: http://reut.rs/1RlIb9r

attachment.name: Sunni states back Saudi Arabia in growing row with Iran
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Saudi Arabia's Sunni allies rallied behind the kingdom on Monday and several joined Riyadh in severing or downgrading diplomatic relations with Tehran, deepening a sectarian split across the Middle East.: http://reut.rs/1mv1MJw

attachment.name: Wall Street starts 2016 in the red after China rout
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: U.S. stocks opened sharply lower on the first trading day of 2016 after lackluster Chinese economic data rekindled worries of slowing global growth. Read more: http://reut.rs/1ZKlf71

media.alt: An Islamic State video showing a young boy in military fatigues and an older masked militant who both spoke with British accents should be viewed as a propaganda tool, Prime Minister David Cameron said on Monday.

attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: An Islamic State video showing a young boy in military fatigues and an older masked militant who both spoke with British accents should be viewed as a propaganda tool, Prime Minister David Cameron said on Monday.

message: The video shows the killing of five men accused of spying for the West. http://reut.rs/1Z276VD

attachment.name: Iran says boosting oil exports depends on future demand
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: A rise in Iran's crude oil exports once sanctions against it are lifted depends on future global oil demand and should not further weaken oil prices, senior officials were quoted as saying. Read more: http://reut.rs/1mzItxU

attachment.name: Suicide bomber blows himself up near Kabul airport: police
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: A suicide bomber in a car blew himself up close to a police checkpoint near Kabul airport on Monday but caused no other casualties, a police spokesman said. Read more: http://reut.rs/1ZKbO7k

attachment.name: Southern Illinois battles flooding as Mississippi River builds downstream
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Residents of flooded areas in far southern Illinois anxiously waited for the swollen Mississippi River to peak on Sunday, with hundreds electing to remain in their homes, as states downstream prepared for the rising waters.

attachment.name: Armed protesters occupy U.S. wildlife headquarters in Oregon
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A group of self-styled militiamen occupied the headquarters of a U.S. wildlife refuge in eastern Oregon in a standoff with authorities, officials and local media reports said on Sunday, in the latest dispute over federal land use in the West.

attachment.name: Exclusive: Poland wants Britain's help over NATO troops in Brexit talks
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Poland could be open to compromise over British demands to limit the rights of European Union migrants if London helps it bolster the NATO presence in central Europe, Foreign Minister Witold Waszczykowski told Reuters.

attachment.name: Big oil to cut investment again in 2016
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: With crude prices at 11-year lows, the world's biggest oil and gas producers are facing their longest period of investment cuts in decades, but are expected to borrow more to preserve the dividends demanded by investors.

attachment.name: Iran says boosting oil exports depends on future demand
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A rise in Iran's crude oil exports once sanctions against it are lifted depends on future global oil demand and should not further weaken oil prices, senior officials were quoted as saying.

attachment.name: Missouri assesses flood damage, U.S. South still imperiled
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Missouri Governor Jay Nixon on Saturday toured communities ravaged by flooding that killed at least 31 people in several states and forced large-scale evacuations, as the danger of rising waters shifted to Arkansas and beyond.

attachment.name: White House: Iran work for nuclear deal likely finished in coming weeks
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The White House expects that Iran will finish the work it needs to trigger implementation of a landmark nuclear deal with world powers in the coming weeks, White House deputy national security adviser Ben Rhodes said on Saturday.

attachment.name: Shi'ite Muslims worldwide decry execution of Saudi cleric
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Saudi Arabia's execution of a leading cleric from the Shi'ite Muslim minority drew protests from around the world against the ruling Al Saud family and threatened to further intensify a wave of sectarian conflict in the Middle East.

attachment.name: Vietnam protests after China lands plane on disputed Spratlys
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Vietnam formally accused China of violating its sovereignty and a recent confidence-building pact on Saturday by landing a plane on an airstrip Beijing has built in a contested part of the South China Sea.

attachment.name: Anti-IS group claims cyber-attack on BBC, says was only a test
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A group of computer hackers that wants to target Islamic State has claimed it was behind a cyber attack on the BBC which it intended as a test of its own capabilities, according to messages sent to a reporter at the broadcaster on Saturday.

attachment.name: British soldiers may face Iraq prosecutions: investigator
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: British soldiers may be put on trial for alleged crimes committed in Iraq including murder, the head of a government unit investigating claims of torture and unlawful killing said in an interview published on Saturday.

attachment.name: Oil prices could hit low point in first quarter: BP's Dudley
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The slump in global oil prices could hit bottom in early 2016 although prices are likely to remain low for the next couple of years, BP (BP.L) Chief Executive Officer Bob Dudley said.

attachment.name: Putin names United States among threats in new Russian security strategy
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A new appraisal names the United States as one of the threats to Russia's national security for the first time, a sign of how relations with the west have deteriorated in recent years.

attachment.name: Defiant Iran pledges to ramp up missile program, in challenge for Obama
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A series of Iranian officials vowed on Friday to expand Tehran's missile capabilities, a challenge to the United States which has threatened to impose new sanctions even as the vast bulk of its measures against Iran are due to be lifted under a nuclear deal.

attachment.name: Rival Taliban factions agree on ceasefire; leader Mansour absent
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Rival factions of the Afghan Taliban agreed to stop deadly infighting, officials said, but tensions remained over the status of new leader Mullah Akhtar Mansour, who has not been seen since reportedly being shot last month.

attachment.name: Terrified families emerge from rubble after battle of Ramadi
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Terrified families waved white flags as they emerged from homes reduced to rubble in the Iraqi city of Ramadi, where government troops were still battling Islamic State fighters holed up on Friday, five days after the army recaptured the city center.

attachment.name: Skywriters over Rose Parade plead: 'Anybody but Trump'
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Five planes flew over the annual Rose Parade in Pasadena, California, on Friday writing messages in the sky that included "America is great!

attachment.name: 'Unforgettable' singer Natalie Cole dead at 65
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Grammy-winning singer Natalie Cole, whose biggest hit came in a virtual duet with her late father, pop legend Nat King Cole, of his decades-old hit "Unforgettable," has died at the age of 65, her family said on Friday.

attachment.name: Defiant Iran pledges to ramp up missile program, in challenge for Obama

attachment.name: Obama, frustrated by Congress, plans unilateral gun control steps
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: President Barack Obama, frustrated by Congress' inaction on gun control, will meet with U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch on Monday to discuss ways of reducing gun violence unilaterally through measures that do not require congressional approval.

attachment.name: Shaman rituals in Siberia
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: In the Tuva region of southern Siberia, an area inhabited by historically cattle-herding nomads, people consult local shamans to find out more about their destiny or address medical and other problems. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1OmPAo8

attachment.name: Turkey's Erdogan cites Hitler's Germany as example of presidential system
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan, who is pushing for executive powers, cites Hitler's Germany as an example of an effective presidential system, in comments broadcast by Turkish media on Friday.

attachment.name: Blanketed in smog
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: In Sarajevo, the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Ponijeri to the north, residents have had more than the usual winter cold and darkness to cope with lately. See more: http://reut.rs/1P2cYnm

attachment.name: Republican Carson's campaign manager, 20 staff quit
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: U.S. Republican Ben Carson's 2016 presidential bid was thrown into chaos on Thursday when his campaign manager and some 20 other staff members quit amid infighting, dropping poll numbers and negative media coverage.

attachment.name: New year brings minimum wage hikes for Americans in 14 states
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: As the United States marks more than six years without an increase in the federal minimum wage of $7.25 an hour, 14 states and several cities are moving forward with their own increases, with most set to start taking effect on Friday.

attachment.name: Firefighters tackle Dubai blaze after all-night effort, investigate cause
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Firefighters on Friday appeared to have mostly extinguished a blaze that suddenly engulfed one of Dubai's most prominent skyscrapers on New Year's Eve, according to Reuters witnesses.

attachment.name: North Korea's Kim blames South for mistrust in New Year speech
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un blamed South Korea on Friday for increased mistrust in a New Year speech after a year of heightened tension between the rival countries.

attachment.name: Germany shuts Munich train stations after tip IS planned attack
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Germany shut down two train stations in Munich about an hour before midnight on Thursday following a tip from the intelligence service of a friendly country that the Islamic State (IS) militant group was planning a suicide bomb attack.

attachment.name: Jubilance in Times Square as New York marks the new year
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: More than a million people in New York's Times Square hailed the arrival of 2016 early Friday with kisses, cheers and a measure of relief as America's biggest New Year's Eve celebration unfolded without a hitch under a blanket of unprecedented security.
See how New Year's Eve was celebrated around the world. http://reut.rs/1SpuMy5

attachment.name: Blaze hits Dubai skyscraper, New Year's fireworks proceed nearby
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Fire engulfed a 63-storey skyscraper in Dubai on Thursday night, but with the block evacuated and only minor injuries reported authorities went ahead with a New Year's fireworks display at the world's tallest building a few hundred meters away.

attachment.name: Cosby faces big financial threat from civil lawsuits: legal experts
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Civil lawsuits accusing Bill Cosby of sex abuse and defamation could do major damage to the entertainer's wealth, regardless of how a criminal prosecution plays out, lawyers who have handled similar cases said on Thursday.

attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: SeaWorld sued California authorities, seeking to overturn a decision that allows the San Diego theme park to expand its orca habitat only if it stops breeding killer whales in captivity. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1mi9OoN

attachment.name: Annual reports offer front-page warnings
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: 'Signs of corporate trouble lurk in annual reports – and sometimes you don’t even need to look beyond the cover to see the problem. A smug title may be a sign that hubris has set in,' warns Reuters opinion columnist  Quentin Webb. Read more: http://reut.rs/1R7LBg8

attachment.name: Severe floods hit Missouri as U.S. storms sweep north
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Floods in Missouri forced hundreds of residents out of their homes on Tuesday after four days of storms sent rivers to record levels, killing at least 13 people, closing hundreds of roads and halting shipping on the swollen Mississippi river. More details: http://reut.rs/1MGpRS3

attachment.name: Twitter clarifies rules on banned content, abusive behaviour
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: "You may not promote violence against or directly attack or threaten other people on the basis of race, ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, religious affiliation, age, disability or disease," according to the revised rules. Read more: http://reut.rs/1OZ2g0W

attachment.name: KaloBios Pharmaceutical files for bankruptcy
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: KaloBios Pharmaceuticals, which fired its controversial chief executive, Martin Shkreli, earlier this month, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Tuesday in the U.S. bankruptcy court for the District of Delaware. More details: http://reut.rs/1OYXssr

media.alt: The modern autocrat will often have regular elections (which he always wins), a parliament with an opposition (that isn’t a threat), and most of the institutions of a democratic society, such as a vaguely independent judicial system, “free” media and freedom of travel for citizens.

message: Propaganda, TV shows and films constantly feeding a sense of national and self-worth, can, in the modern autocracy, substitute for prison camps and torture dungeons. But they cannot do so forever, writes Reuters Opinion columnist John Lloyd. http://reut.rs/1Pw1jQg

attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: A South African lion called Brutus who fathered three "miracle" cubs despite having had a vasectomy in his youth is going back to the vet to have the operation a second time.

message: Brutus and his partner Nala, who live at the Drakenstein Lion Park near Cape Town, stunned staff at the sanctuary when she gave birth to three "miracle" cubs just before Christmas. Read more: http://reut.rs/1R6m0E8

attachment.name: Jade and heroin in Myanmar
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Narcotics addiction is rife among the gem scavengers or "handpickers" who flock to the northern township of Hpakant, producer of some of the world's highest quality jade, in the hope of finding lumps of the precious stone overlooked by big miners. Find out more about the lives of the jade scavengers: http://reut.rs/1NNWIsl

attachment.name: Special Report: Pentagon thwarts Obama's effort to close Guantanamo
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Negotiating prisoner releases with the Pentagon was like "punching a pillow," said James Dobbins, the State Department special representative to Afghanistan and Pakistan from 2013 to 2014. Defense Department officials "would come to a meeting, they would not make a counter-argument," he said. "And then nothing would happen." Read more: http://reut.rs/1OWLMGC

attachment.caption: reut.rs

message:
Pro-Kremlin Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov quickly denied Khasiev was a spy.
But interviews with more than a dozen people who knew Khasiev in Russia suggest the 23-year-old man had connections to both Muslim groups and Russian security and seemed to live a double life. Read more: http://reut.rs/1MELh29

media.alt: A wealthy Texas teen who had been a fugitive after breaking his probation sentence for killing four people while driving drunk, will be returned to the United States after being caught in Mexico, Mexican authorities said on Tuesday.

attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: A wealthy Texas teen who had been a fugitive after breaking his probation sentence for killing four people while driving drunk, will be returned to the United States after being caught in Mexico, Mexican authorities said on Tuesday.

attachment.name: Stabilizing oil lifts European shares and bond yields
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: European stocks rose and euro zone bond yields edged up on Tuesday as oil prices stabilized above 11-year lows on the back of prospects for lower temperatures on both sides of the Atlantic. Read more: http://reut.rs/1mg50R1

attachment.name: Former Israeli PM Olmert's jail term cut, cleared of main charge
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message:
Olmert, 70, will begin serving his term on Feb. 15, according to live reports from the Jerusalem courtroom, making him the first former head of government in Israel to go to prison.

The charges related to his 1992-2003 term as Jerusalem's mayor and real estate deals in the city. Read more: http://reut.rs/1PupPRM

attachment.name: Winter storm brings snow, sleet to Midwest, Northeast after slamming Texas
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: A storm system that triggered deadly tornadoes and flooding in the U.S. Midwest and Southwest was pushing north on Tuesday, bringing snow and ice to a swath of the country from Iowa to Massachusetts, and setting up another day of air travel delays. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1OWGlY6

media.alt: European Athletics president Svein Arne Hansen does not expect Russia to return to international competition in time for next year's Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.

attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: A book to be published in Hong Kong in the new year says Zhou Enlai, Communist China's much-respected first premier, was probably gay despite his long marriage, and had once been in love with a male schoolmate two years his junior. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1MEJVV3

media.alt: Sometime in the future, some notes are found. Purportedly written by an adviser to David Cameron, they chronicle events in the month after the UK voted to leave the European Union. It’s a vision of banker exoduses, surprising new investors and mountains of unsold pork pies.

attachment.name: Britain’s exit from Europe: 28 days later
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: Sometime in the future, some notes are found. Purportedly written by an adviser to David Cameron, they chronicle events in the month after the UK voted to leave the European Union. It’s a vision of banker exoduses, surprising new investors and mountains of unsold pork pies.

message: Sometime in the future, a series of notes is found in the abandoned ruins of British prime ministerial residence 10 Downing Street. Purportedly written by a private secretary to David Cameron, they chronicle the events in the month after UK voters decided they wanted to leave the European Union. It’s a vision of banker exoduses, surprising new investors and mountains of unsold pork pies. Find out more with Reuters Breakingviews: http://reut.rs/1OcDXjE

attachment.caption: reut.rs

attachment.name: Families demand Chicago police, mayor explain shooting deaths
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The families of two black Chicagoans killed by police accused officers on Sunday of having used excessive force and Mayor Rahm Emanuel of having failed them, piling pressure on a city facing a U.S. federal probe over possible racial bias in policing.

attachment.name: Presidential hopeful Trump blasts Republican expected to endorse rival
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump assailed a leading committee chairman in Congress on Sunday for backing Marco Rubio, Trump's rival for the party's nomination.

attachment.name: Paranoid: North Korea's computer operating system mirrors its political one
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: North Korea's homegrown computer operating system mirrors its political one, according to two German researchers who have delved into the code: a go-it-alone approach, a high degree of paranoia and invasive snooping on users.

attachment.name: Hezbollah leader tells Israel to brace for retaliation over Qantar's death
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The leader of Lebanon's Hezbollah group said on Sunday that Israel miscalculated by killing prominent militant Samir Qantar in Syria last week, saying that retaliation for his death was inevitable, whatever the consequences.

attachment.name: Russia says air force has not hit civilian targets in Syria
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Russian air forces have not hit civilian targets since they started a bombing campaign in Syria nearly three months ago, a senior Russian officer said in an interview with Rossiya 24 television.

attachment.name: Eight killed in Dallas area amid tornadoes, flooding
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Eight people died in the greater Dallas area as a storm system brought tornadoes and flooding on Saturday, increasing the death toll from harsh weather in the southern United States this week to 26, according to officials and local media.

attachment.name: Torrential rain brings flooding to northern England
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Britain's Meteorological Office issued two of its most severe weather warnings on Saturday after days of torrential rain in northern England caused rivers to burst their banks and flood several villages.

media.alt: Headsets from Facebook, HTC, Sony and others will help turn VR into reality in 2016. The market could generate $10 bln or more in sales within five years, provided coders create games and apps with wide appeal. Software houses, hardware makers and tech giants should all benefit.

attachment.name: Virtual reality will spring to life
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: Headsets from Facebook, HTC, Sony and others will help turn VR into reality in 2016. The market could generate $10 bln or more in sales within five years, provided coders create games and apps with wide appeal. Software houses, hardware makers and tech giants should all benefit.

message: Reuters Breakingviews columnist Quentin Webb predicts that virtual reality will spring to life in 2016. He thinks that newly launched headsets from Facebook, HTC, Sony and others will help turn the immersive artificial environments of VR into what could soon become a $10-billion-a-year commercial reality. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1YDZzXC

media.alt: Once derided as the “Albanian army” by Time Warner boss Jeff Bewkes, the video-streaming service is now valued at about the same $55 bln as his company. With some 69 mln subscribers globally, it may be too late for media bosses to do anything about this beast they helped create.

attachment.name: Turkish PM says pro-Kurdish HDP 'rooted in violence', cancels meeting
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Turkey's prime minister on Saturday canceled a planned meeting with the pro-Kurdish Peoples' Democratic Party (HDP), saying its politics was rooted in violence, as government forces pursued a security operation in the mainly Kurdish southeast.

media.alt: A survey of Breakingviews readers suggests that a year from now, the U.S. will have its first female president and Yahoo’s CEO may be free to give her a hand. Uber’s valuation will stall, as worries about Islamic State accelerate. In other news, Twitter hasn’t made us any happier.

attachment.name: Top trades of 2016: Clinton, Mayer, Isis and Uber
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: A survey of Breakingviews readers suggests that a year from now, the U.S. will have its first female president and Yahoo’s CEO may be free to give her a hand. Uber’s valuation will stall, as worries about Islamic State accelerate. In other news, Twitter hasn’t made us any happier.

message: A year from now, U.S. presidential hopeful Hillary Clinton will snag a plum new job. Marissa Mayer may be free to help her after she is ousted as Yahoo chief executive, taxi app Uber’s valuation will stall, but the wider tech industry will race ahead. Or so Reuters Breakingviews readers seem to think. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1YBE0Hb

media.alt: There may never be a better time for Latin America’s No. 3 economy and the hedge fund to end a 14-year spat over defaulted bonds. New President Macri needs access to global debt markets; another defiant Peronist could succeed him if he fails. Stalemate is looking pointless.

attachment.name: Belgian college's concerns over Paris attacker ignored: newspapers
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A police commission is interviewing staff at a Brussels college after education authorities failed to act on concerns that a student who later became one of the Paris suicide bombers had been radicalized, two Belgian newspapers said on Saturday.

media.alt: U.S. gun control activists called for expanded background checks for firearms purchasers and for a ban on sales to people on federal watch lists on Monday, in a protest marking the third anniversary of the massacre at a Connecticut elementary school.

attachment.name: On Sandy Hook anniversary, U.S. activists call for gun restrictions
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: U.S. gun control activists called for expanded background checks for firearms purchasers and for a ban on sales to people on federal watch lists on Monday, in a protest marking the third anniversary of the massacre at a Connecticut elementary school.

message: On Dec. 14, 2012, 20-year-old Adam Lanza shot and killed 20 first-graders and six educators at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut, an attack that stands as one of the deadliest mass shootings in U.S. history. http://reut.rs/1lIYwcW

media.alt: It was an agreement born from a fear of failure, delivered by the smoothness of French diplomacy.

attachment.name: How the world learned its lesson and got a climate deal
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: It was an agreement born from a fear of failure, delivered by the smoothness of French diplomacy.

message: Six years earlier, countries had bitterly walked away from global climate talks in Copenhagen without a deal. The decision to reassemble in Paris to try again was a gamble: another collapse could the end world’s ability to forge a common approach to dealing with climate change. Read more: http://reut.rs/1I4diFc

media.alt: Temporary power supplier Aggreko has pulled out of a tender to provide generators to the Olympics in Rio de Janeiro next year, the spokesman for Rio 2016 told Reuters, dealing a major blow to organizers rushing to secure an energy source for the world's largest sporting event.

attachment.name: Exclusive: Aggreko pulls Olympic tender, leaves Rio 2016 power in doubt
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: Temporary power supplier Aggreko has pulled out of a tender to provide generators to the Olympics in Rio de Janeiro next year, the spokesman for Rio 2016 told Reuters, dealing a major blow to organizers rushing to secure an energy source for the world's largest sporting event.

attachment.name: In American mosques, growing safety concerns — and more armed guards
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: From the suburbs of Los Angeles to the outskirts of Washington, D.C., mosques around the United States are warily stepping up security in the face of growing fears about reprisals on American Muslims.

attachment.name: China recommends life term for wife of disgraced official Bo Xilai
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A Beijing court has recommended a suspended death sentence for the wife of disgraced Politburo member Bo Xilai be commuted to life in prison, after she showed repentance and committed no further crime, Chinese media said on Monday.

attachment.name: Five killed in fire in abandoned California house
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Five people were killed and another was injured in a house fire on Sunday at a residence with boards over its windows and doors in the California city of Fresno, the fire department said.

attachment.name: EXCLUSIVE - U.S. investigates broadcasters in widening FIFA case
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A sports marketing company that was described in a sweeping indictment this month as retaining contracts because of the "support" of corrupt soccer officials has longstanding ties to the U.S. entertainment company 21st Century Fox, according to securities filings and other government documents.

attachment.name: Oil prices drop for seventh session on oversupply worries
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Crude oil futures fell for a seventh straight session on Monday, their longest losing streak since mid-2014, as a forecast from the International Energy Agency (IEA) that the global supply glut was likely to deepen next year dragged on prices.

attachment.name: As Cruz rises in U.S. presidential polls, Trump calls him 'maniac'
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump had a new target on Sunday, calling fellow White House contender Ted Cruz "a little bit of a maniac" as the U.S. senator passed him in an Iowa opinion poll.

attachment.name: Asia stocks drop as oil rout deepens, yuan extends slide
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Asian stocks fell on Monday and China's yuan hit fresh 4-1/2 year lows as plunging oil prices added to investors' nervousness about riskier assets ahead of an expected U.S. rate rise by the Federal Reserve later in the week.

attachment.name: Merkel dismisses U.S. request for more military help against Islamic State
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Chancellor Angela Merkel on Sunday brushed off what a Germany magazine said was a request from the United States to provide more military help in the fight against Islamic State.

attachment.name: Dozens die in strikes on Syrian school district, other areas
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Intense air and missile strikes on a school district and other areas in insurgent-held Damascus suburbs killed dozens of people on Sunday, including children, a monitoring group and local rescue workers said.

attachment.name: As Cruz rises in presidential polls, Trump calls him 'maniac'
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump had a new target on Sunday, calling fellow White House contender Ted Cruz "a little bit of a maniac" as the U.S. senator surpassed him in an Iowa poll.Cruz's dogged pursuit of conservative Iowa voters has paid off in the form of a 10-point lead over Trump in the state, which has one of the earliest presidential contests.

attachment.name: California sheriff deputies kill armed black man, video appears to show him crawl away
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Deputies in southern California shot dead an armed black man who refused to drop his weapon, according to law enforcement authorities, but a video posted online by local media appeared to show him crawling away from the officers as they shot him.

attachment.name: Wall Street veterans say rate-hike past is not prologue for markets
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: It has only been six years since the U.S. stock market rout brought on by the financial crisis, but as far as Deena Katz's clients are concerned, that might as well be ancient history.

attachment.name: Russia says fired warning shots at Turkish ship in Aegean to avoid collision
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The Russian Defence Ministry said on Sunday one of its warships, the destroyer Smetlivy, had been forced to fire warning shots at a Turkish vessel in the Aegean Sea to avoid a collision and that it had summoned the Turkish military attache over the incident.

attachment.name: Xi absent as China marks low key Nanjing Massacre anniversary
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: China marked in low-key fashion its second national memorial day for the Nanjing Massacre on Sunday, with President Xi Jinping skipping the main event and a relatively junior official leading the somber ceremony instead.

attachment.name: Armed man shot in Pennsylvania Walmart: reports
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A man armed with handguns and a rifle was shot on Saturday night as he wielded the weapons inside a Pennsylvania Walmart, according to media reports.

attachment.name: Veteran lawmaker Sylvester Turner wins Houston mayoral runoff
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Veteran lawmaker Sylvester Turner edged out Republican businessman Bill King on Saturday to claim victory as the new mayor of Houston, the fourth most-populous U.S. city.

attachment.name: Malls in three U.S. states evacuated on busy holiday shopping day
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Thousands of shoppers were evacuated from malls in at least three states on Saturday as bomb threats or scares disrupted one of the busiest days of year for holiday shopping.

attachment.name: Divers retrieve more items in search for California shooting clues
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: FBI divers picked through the bottom of a San Bernardino lake on Saturday for a third day, seeking evidence related to a married couple who massacred 14 people at a holiday party, in what the bureau has called an act of terror inspired by Islamic State.

attachment.name: North Korean pop band cancels Beijing concert, leaves for home
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: An all-female North Korean pop group formed by leader Kim Jong Un abruptly canceled a Beijing concert on Saturday because of "communication issues" and headed home, Chinese media and the concert venue said.

attachment.name: Malls in three U.S. states evacuated on busy holiday shopping day
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Thousands of shoppers were evacuated from malls in at least three states on Saturday as bomb threats or scares disrupted one of the busiest days of year for holiday shopping.

attachment.name: Third Avenue junk fund blowup exposes risks of unsellable assets
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: The blow-up of Third Avenue Management's junk bond fund this week, the biggest mutual fund failure since the financial crisis, show the dangers of loading up on risky assets that are hard to trade even in good times.

attachment.name: Swiss say arrest two Syrians, probing possible Islamist ties
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Two Syrian men were arrested in Geneva on Friday after traces of explosives were found in their car, Switzerland's attorney general said on Saturday, confirming media reports.

message: A turning point on fossil fuels as world seals landmark climate accord: http://reut.rs/1SUfCil

attachment.name: Thousands of Iraqis in Baghdad, Basra protest Turkish deployment in north
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Thousands of Iraqis protested on Saturday against Ankara's deployment of troops to a base near the northern city of Mosul, with some burning Turkish flags and threatening violence against the soldiers for what they see as a violation of sovereignty.

attachment.name: At least 848 Afghan civilian casualties in Kunduz: U.N.
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: At least 848 Afghan civilians were killed or wounded following a Taliban attack on the northern city of Kunduz in September, according to a U.N. report that detailed the grim conditions endured by residents during two weeks of fighting. Read more: http://reut.rs/1RgYbeg

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A Mississippi man charged with shooting and killing two police officers in May was found unresponsive in his jail cell and later was pronounced dead, a sheriff's office official said on Saturday.

attachment.name: Blasts near hospital in Syria's Homs city kill 16: monitor
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Twin explosions in a government-controlled neighborhood of Syria's Homs city killed at least 16 people and wounded scores more on Saturday, a group monitoring the war said.

attachment.caption: reut.rs

attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Most Republican voters said they were not bothered by his remarks, though many said the comments could still hurt Trump's chances of becoming president. Read more: http://reut.rs/1NV5DVF

attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: An all-female North Korean pop band formed by leader Kim Jong Un abruptly canceled a Beijing concert on Saturday and headed back home to Pyongyang, Chinese media and the concert venue said.

attachment.name: World climate accord hailed as turning point from fossil fuels
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: French Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius presented a landmark global climate accord on Saturday, a "historic" measure for transforming the world's fossil fuel-driven economy within decades and turn the tide on global warming. Read more: http://reut.rs/1NUZ4Cx

message: Women candidates and female voters are set to cast their ballots for the first time ever in Saudi Arabia's local municipal elections.

attachment.name: Saudi Prince Alwaleed calls Trump a disgrace
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Saudi billionaire Prince Alwaleed bin Talal has called Donald Trump a disgrace to the United States following his call for a ban on Muslims entering the country, and demanded the Republican front-runner withdraw from the U.S. presidential race.

attachment.name: Volatility the surest bet in stocks after Fed meets
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Stock market investors are ready for the first U.S. Federal Reserve interest rate hike in nearly a decade next week, but they may not be fully prepared for all of the nuanced remarks likely to accompany that announcement.

attachment.name: Exclusive: Trump lead among Republicans undiminished in first poll after Muslim comments
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Donald Trump held onto his commanding lead in the Republican race for the White House after his call for a ban on Muslims entering the United States was condemned worldwide, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll, the first national survey conducted entirely after the billionaire's remarks.

attachment.name: Iraq urges U.N. council to demand immediate Turkish troop withdrawal
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Iraq appealed to the United Nations Security Council on Friday to demand an immediate and unconditional withdrawal of all Turkish troops from northern Iraq, calling Turkey's military incursion a "flagrant violation" of international law.

attachment.name: Afghan forces end siege near Spanish embassy in Kabul
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Afghan security forces suppressed a suicide attack on a guest house near the Spanish embassy in Kabul, killing three Taliban fighters after hours of intermittent gunfire and explosions that lasted into the early hours of Saturday.

attachment.name: Key Senate panel chairman opens inquiry into California massacre
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: Nine days after 14 people were shot dead in California by a married couple the FBI says were inspired by Islamic extremism, the Republican chairman of a key U.S. Senate panel demanded the Justice Department on Friday turn over much of the evidence collected so far in the case.

attachment.name: Islamic State can make fake Syrian passports: U.S. report
attachment.caption: www.reuters.com

message: A U.S. government agency report has warned that Islamic State has the ability to create fake Syrian passports, a federal official confirmed on Friday.

attachment.name: Islamic State owes Donald Trump a debt of gratitude
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Beyond the damage he is causing to America’s image and values, Trump is also handing a propaganda victory to the militant forces that he supposedly wants to defeat, especially Islamic State - says Reuters opinion columnist Mohamad Bazzi. Read more: http://reut.rs/1NSbScL

media.alt: Two of the women sexually assaulted by a former Oklahoma City policeman said on Friday they feared for their lives after the officer threatened them with arrest and violence if they did not perform sexual acts on him.

attachment.name: Victims of Oklahoma ex-officer said they were forced into sex through fear
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: Two of the women sexually assaulted by a former Oklahoma City policeman said on Friday they feared for their lives after the officer threatened them with arrest and violence if they did not perform sexual acts on him.

message: Two of the women sexually assaulted by a former Oklahoma City cop said they feared for their lives after the officer threatened them with arrest and violence if they did not perform sexual acts on him. "I kept pleading, 'Don't make me do this, sir. Are you going to shoot me?’ I was so afraid, so helpless,” recalled one of them. http://reut.rs/1lC1dgm

attachment.name: Europe’s got its own Donald Trumps
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Dependent on secular, civic values and buoyed by the success of the economies which sustained democratic states, European liberal democracies were welcoming to all - until many came, says Reuters opinion columnist John Lloyd. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1OW7crC

attachment.name: Behind the scenes of 'The Nutcracker'
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: When the curtain rises for "The Nutcracker" at St Petersburg's Mikhailovsky Theatre, it is the culmination of hundreds of hours of toil and sweat by dancers, costume makers, set designers and musicians. Find out how a production is made: http://reut.rs/1NOTCRI

media.alt: Donald Trump held onto his commanding lead in the Republican race for the White House after his call for a ban on Muslims entering the United States was condemned worldwide, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll, the first national survey conducted entirely after the billionaire's remarks.

attachment.name: Exclusive: Trump lead among Republicans undiminished in first poll after Muslim comments
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: Donald Trump held onto his commanding lead in the Republican race for the White House after his call for a ban on Muslims entering the United States was condemned worldwide, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll, the first national survey conducted entirely after the billionaire's remarks.

message:
"He's really saying what everybody else is feeling." Most Republican voters said they were not bothered by Donald Trump's call for a ban on Muslims entering the United States that drew worldwide condemnation, a Reuters/Ipsos poll found. 
http://reut.rs/1ReQzZA

media.alt: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd (BABA.N) has agreed to buy Hong Kong's flagship English-language newspaper, the South China Morning Post (SCMP), in the most politically sensitive acquisition by the e-commerce giant to date.

attachment.name: Alibaba agrees to buy South China Morning Post in Hong Kong
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd (BABA.N) has agreed to buy Hong Kong's flagship English-language newspaper, the South China Morning Post (SCMP), in the most politically sensitive acquisition by the e-commerce giant to date.

message: Alibaba said it's going to buy Hong Kong's flagship newspaper, the South China Morning Post.  The purchase, which follows a string of media deals by Alibaba, is likely to raise concerns in Hong Kong, where the South China Morning Post occupies an important position among the English-speaking elite. Chinese-language dailies may be more influential than the Post, but changes in its editorial direction are seen as a barometer for press freedom under Chinese rule. http://reut.rs/1NSUPaH

attachment.name: Canada welcomes refugees | Reuters.com
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: The first plane load of Syrian refugees departed Beirut, on a military aircraft bound for Toronto. See more: http://reut.rs/1QAGG7a

media.alt: The website for Trump Towers, Donald Trump's glitzy signature skyscraper in Manhattan, went offline for about an hour on Friday after activist hacking group Anonymous denounced the real-estate mogul and Republican presidential front-runner for his anti-Muslim comments.

attachment.name: Trump Tower website has outage after Anonymous' anti-Trump rant
attachment.caption: reut.rs
attachment.description: The website for Trump Towers, Donald Trump's glitzy signature skyscraper in Manhattan, went offline for about an hour on Friday after activist hacking group Anonymous denounced the real-estate mogul and Republican presidential front-runner for his anti-Muslim comments.

message: Guess who's the target of activist hacking group Anonymous' latest attack? None other than Donald Trump. The website for Trump Towers, Donald Trump's glitzy signature skyscraper in Manhattan, went offline for about an hour after Anonymous denounced the Republican presidential front-runner for his anti-Muslim comments. http://reut.rs/1NSJ3wS

attachment.name: NY judge shuts down daily fantasy sports in state; DraftKings to appeal
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: A New York judge on Friday ruled that daily fantasy sports companies FanDuel and DraftKings must cease operating in the state for now, in what could be a crippling blow to the fast-growing, multibillion-dollar industry. Find out more: http://reut.rs/1OWbrDq

attachment.name: Morocco issues arrest warrant for Paris attack suspect
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Moroccan authorities have issued an arrest warrant for Salah Abdeslam, the Paris attack suspect who is at the center of an international manhunt, according to the Moroccan police.: http://reut.rs/1SS4PFm

attachment.name: Syrian antiquities chief says Turkey refuses to return looted art
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: One museum at the 2,000-year-old Roman city of Palmyra, a UNESCO World Heritage site the jihadi militants took over in May, has been turned into an Islamic State prison and courtroom, Syria's antiquities chief Maamoun Abdulkarim told Reuters. More details: http://reut.rs/1QAiphr

attachment.name: Divers search lake for evidence in Southern California massacre

message: The FBI also revealed investigators were looking into any connections there may have been between one of the two killers in San Bernardino last week and four men arrested in 2012 in a separate federal terrorism case brought in nearby Riverside, California. Read more: http://reut.rs/1IZPfBX

attachment.name: France to present draft climate accord on Saturday, optimistic
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: French Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius said on Friday he was confident a global accord to combat climate change could be adopted after a final draft will be released on Saturday morning. Find out more about the decisions being made at the climate summit in Paris: http://reut.rs/1IZMyR2

attachment.name: Oklahoma ex-policeman guilty of raping women while on duty
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: A former Oklahoma City police officer was found guilty of crimes including rape and sexual battery by a jury on Thursday in a case where prosecutors said he preyed on women who had trouble with the law, hoping their word would not stand up against his. More details: http://reut.rs/1Re3Qlj

attachment.name: Turkey says to 'reorganize' military personnel in Iraqi camp
attachment.caption: reut.rs

message: Turkey has decided in talks with Iraqi officials to "reorganize" its military personnel at the Bashiqa camp near the northern Iraqi city of Mosul, the prime minister's office said on Friday, after a dispute emerged with Baghdad over the deployment. Read more: http://reut.rs/1QAuL9j
